alert.note: Alert for Dundy; Hitchcock (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 26 at 8:43PM CDT until July 26 at 9:30PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM MDT/930 PM CDT/ FOR CHEYENNE...NORTHWESTERN THOMAS...WESTERN RAWLINS AND NORTHERN SHERMAN COUNTIES IN NORTHWESTERN KANSAS...WESTERN HITCHCOCK AND DUNDY COUNTIES IN SOUTHWESTERN NEBRASKA... At 741 PM MDT/841 PM CDT/, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 5 miles west of Benkelman to 6 miles west of Bird City to 11 miles north of Goodland, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...AWOS. At 837 PM CDT, a 64 mph wind gust was reported at the Saint Francis Airport. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. These severe storms will be near... Bird City around 850 PM CDT. Benkelman around 750 PM MDT. McDonald around 905 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Blakeman, Beardsley, Parks, Wheeler and Max. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. These thunderstorms will produce damaging winds resulting in areas of near zero visibility in blowing dirt. Use extreme caution if you must travel and be alert for rapidly changing visibility. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
